; Mon, 09 Oct 2023 17:25:03 +0800 泰国喋血枪击案：14岁持枪少年和40声枪响http://www.infzm.com/contents/258301
;;2023-10-09 16:06:52;
;

;;

;

;; (Visual China/Picture) ;

;

;Three days after the incident, the victim of the Siam Paragon shooting in Thailand finally apologized.

;

;On October 6, 2023, the parents of the suspect in the shooting issued a letter of apology, apologizing to the victims, injured and their families, and promising to fully cooperate with the investigation. They said in the letter that they would do their best to take responsibility, fully cooperate with the police and other departments to find out the truth, and do their best to mitigate the impact of the incident.

;

;On the same day, the Thai government announced a compensation plan. Suthawan, Thailand’s Minister of Tourism and Sports, said that Thailand will provide 6.2 million baht (approximately RMB 1.23 million) in compensation for each victim.

;

;Three days ago, on October 3, just a week after Thailand implemented a visa-free policy for Chinese tourists, a series of piercing gunshots rang out in the Siam Paragon shopping mall, and panicked crowds ran in all directions. The tragic shooting resulted in 2 deaths and 5 injuries. The Chinese victim was only 34 years old. At the time of the incident, she was traveling in Thailand with her 5-year-old twin daughters, and they originally planned to take a flight back to China early in the morning on October 4.

;

;What is surprising is that the perpetrator of the shooting was a boy who had just turned 14 years old. He is accused of suffering from mental illness and has been sent to a mental hospital in Bangkok for evaluation of his mental condition.

;

;The sudden shooting not only made tourists in Thailand uneasy, but also worried Thailand, which is eager to revive the tourism industry.

;

;Jidi, chairman of the Thailand Tourism Marketing Association, told Thailand's "Public Opinion" that due to the vicious shooting at Siam Paragon, the number of foreign tourists to Thailand may decrease by 1 million in the fourth quarter of 2023. Revenue shrank by 50 billion baht (approximately RMB 10 billion).

;

;;40 gunshots;

;

;If it weren’t for this shooting tragedy, Li Qian’s family could have spent a happy holiday in Thailand.

;

;At noon on October 3, 2023, Li Qian and his wife arrived in Bangkok by plane with their three-year-old child. After checking in at Chatrium Hotel, they were picked up directly from the hotel at around 4 p.m. The shuttle bus arrives at Siam Paragon.

;

;Paragon is located in Siam Square in the heart of Bangkok. It is the most famous luxury shopping mall in Bangkok and was once rated as the most photographed place in the world by Instagram. Li Qian decided to make the first stop of her trip to Thailand here, but what she didn't expect was that she would be greeted by continuous gunshots.

;

;“As soon as I got to the second floor, I heard a loud bang. I immediately had a bad premonition. Before I could react, there were two more bangs and bangs in succession, and then... I heard screams from downstairs, and people started to run away. My husband rushed to the third floor with the child in his arms, and then there were several gunshots. I was so scared that my legs were weak, and I felt that bullets were behind me. He was about to be hit at any time." Li Qian recalled to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;At 3:35 pm on October 3, the assailant took the light rail and entered Siam Paragon. Surveillance video showed that five minutes later, he walked into the bathroom on the M floor carrying a schoolbag containing bullets. At 4:10, gunshots were first heard in the bathroom. Immediately afterwards, a long-haired man wearing a black shirt and a baseball cap with an American flag printed on his head came out and started shooting at the crowd.

;

;When the gunfire rang out, Huahua was in the aisle separated from the bathroom where the incident occurred, waiting for friends who were shopping at the Chanel store.

;

;“I didn’t know the murderer was next to us at the time. I just heard the gunshots very clearly.” Huahua told Southern Weekend reporters, “I thought it was a robbery of a luxury store at first. It was nothing special. It wasn’t until we later watched the news and discovered he was right next to us that we started to feel a little scared.”

;

;At 4:25, the assailant came to the second floor and continued shooting. Minutes later, he took the escalator to the third floor and continued shooting.

;

;Subsequently, the gunman called the Thai police phone number to surrender, and clearly told the police his location and specific clothing. At 5:10, he was arrested in a home furnishing store on the third floor.

;

;The "Bangkok Post" quoted a source familiar with the investigation as saying that before his arrest, the suspect fired about 40 shots in the mall, and a total of 11 shots were found on the dead and injured. bullet.

;

;Despite the frightening moment, Li Qian and others were at least lucky enough to return home safely. However, a Chinese tourist and a Burmese migrant worker in Thailand left their lives in Thailand.

;

;According to reports from the Thai police, the shooting at Siam Paragon resulted in 2 deaths and 5 injuries, and the initiator was a 14-year-old boy.

;

;According to Thailand's MGR Online news network, the suspect in the shooting incident was born in 2009 and just turned 14 years old on September 21. He is the eldest son in the family. His family is very wealthy, and his father works in a well-known university. The teenager studied in a private school with a tuition fee of hundreds of thousands of baht a year. While at school, he won the Outstanding Student Award for the 2017 academic year.

;

;As Bangkok’s top luxury shopping mall, Siam Paragon claims to have strict security measures. However, the murderer successfully entered with a gun.

;

;Tosak, the director of the Thai National Police, explained in an interview that because the gun involved was modified into a plastic structure, it was not discovered in time, and the security of the mall was not as constant as at the airport. They are very strict, with people coming in and out all the time, and it is difficult for the testing equipment to conduct precise inspections on everyone.

;

;However, many people involved in the shooting recalled to Southern Weekend reporters that Siam Paragon had no security measures and only two or three security guards were on duty at the door.

;

;After the shooting, just a few hours after arriving in Thailand, Li Qian changed her ticket to return to China the next day. "I didn't really feel safe until the moment the plane landed. From a person watching the news to a person in the news, everything was so unreal." Li Qian said that now she hears the gunshots in the video, she is still instantly taken away. Pull back to the scene of the shooting.

;

;Hua Hua and her friends continued to spend a day shopping in Thailand with fear, but they did not dare to go shopping in Siam again.

;

;;Mental problems? ;

;

;Paragon surveillance video showed that when he was arrested, the 14-year-old suspect looked dull, his eyes flashed, and he kept mumbling to himself.

;

;Tosak said the teenager had received treatment at Rajavithi Hospital for mental health problems in the past, but did not take his medication on the day of the incident. "He felt like someone was telling him to shoot this or that person, as if there was another 'him' inside his body."

;

;Another netizen who often plays games online with the assailant teenager said, " He often behaves emotionally, and it is obvious that he has a heavy psychological burden." The netizen also revealed that the young man had mentioned that he had schizophrenia symptoms, but he did not take medication to control it.

;

;However, the boy's parents said that their son was addicted to shooting games, but he had never had any history of mental illness. In an interview with Thai TV station One News31, his mother said she suspected that her child liked to use shooting to vent his emotions.

;

;At present, the young man who committed the crime has been sent to Bangkok Mental Hospital for detention and treatment. Experts from the hospital will evaluate whether he suffers from mental illness.

;

;Washin, a lawyer at Thailand's Mandarin Law Firm, estimates that the results of the mental evaluation will be issued within two or three weeks, and the subsequent inspection report will be handed over to the relevant departments within a month.

;

;Based on reports from Thai media, the shooting was not a whim of the teenager, but was well prepared in advance. The Thai news website The Thaiger bluntly called the shooting a "premeditated murder."

;

;According to the "Bangkok Post" report, the teenager originally planned to buy a real gun online, but because the price was too high, he then borrowed money through an online lending platform and settled for 16,000 baht (approximately RMB 3164) purchased a modified blank gun. In the teenager's home, the police also found two guns and a large amount of ammunition.

;

;Before the incident, the teenager had invited friends with whom he was practicing shooting to go to Siam Paragon. Until the moment he arrived at the mall, he had a video call with his friends, saying that he was "going to shoot." .

;

;After the suspect was arrested, the police found videos from his mobile phone of him practicing with live ammunition at a shooting range, including clips of changing ammunition and shooting targets. Some netizens also posted that they had met the assailant by chance at the "Bangkok Shooting Club" before, and that he was dressed exactly the same as on the day of the attack.

;

;It is still unknown why the former outstanding student turned into a gun-wielding killer. However, Thailand's Public Opinion reported that after preliminary investigation, the police found that the 14-year-old boy who killed someone with a gun at Siam Paragon faced academic difficulties and his academic performance was poor, but his parents forced him to improve his academic performance. There is chat evidence showing that after the suspected teenager was urged by his parents to improve his academic performance, he instead sent a video of himself shooting at the shooting range and said, "I want to go here."

;

;On October 4, the head of the Kyoto Police Station in Bangkok, Thailand, stated that the police filed five preliminary charges against the 14-year-old suspect responsible for the shooting, including intentional homicide, murder, illegal possession of a gun, and unauthorized possession of a gun. Carrying firearms into public places with permission and shooting in public places without permission.

;

;"In Thailand, shootings that cause death can be punished with the death penalty, life imprisonment, or 15 to 20 years in prison. However, because Thailand rarely carries out the death penalty, the maximum penalty is generally only life imprisonment." Waxin analysis , "Now that the suspect is only 14 years old, he will most likely be sentenced to 15-20 years in prison. But at the same time, the court may take measures such as juvenile detention, mental hospital imprisonment, etc. to replace prison time."

;

;"Mental illness cannot be a reason for acquittal, but if it is ultimately determined that there is a mental illness, the court may reduce the sentence based on his relevant medical history, and may ultimately be sentenced to 10-15 years in prison, or even a sentence of no more than Possibility in 10 years," Vaxin added.

;

;;Belated gun control;

;

;This is not the first mass shooting in Thailand. In the past three years, Thailand has suffered three consecutive shooting massacres. The Siam Paragon shooting happened on the first anniversary of the nursery massacre.

;

;On October 6, 2022, a former police officer broke into a nursery with a gun and a knife in Utai Sawang Town, Nongmo Lamphu Province, northeastern Thailand, killing 38 people, 24 of whom were children. . The murderer returned home afterwards, killed his wife and children and committed suicide. Thailand’s Public Broadcasting and Television reported that this was the first large-scale terrorist attack targeting children’s places in Thailand’s history.

;

;Previously in February 2020, a Thai soldier went on a killing spree with a gun in a shopping mall in the northeastern city of Nakhon Ratchasima, killing 29 people and injuring 57 others.

;

;Amnesty International human rights researcher and Thai Tatya Karonwang pointed out that given the occurrence of three similar incidents in recent years, Thai society is reminded that this may not be just an isolated unfortunate incident and the country needs to be re-evaluated. Is gun violence a systemic problem?

;

;Until the shooting, Huahua did not know that it was legal to hold a gun in Thailand, and he never thought that such a thing would happen to him. But in fact, Thailand has one of the highest rates of gun ownership and gun-related deaths in Asia.

;

;A study conducted in 2017 by the "Small Arms Survey", a research institute in Geneva, Switzerland, showed that Thailand's total population is about 70 million, but the number of guns it holds is as many as 10.34 million, of which only 10.34 million are legally registered. About 6.2 million. Investigators estimate that 15 out of every 100 people in Thailand own guns, ranking first in ASEAN and second in Asia after Pakistan.

;

;According to data released by the US think tank "World Population Review" in 2022, Thailand has 3.91 gun deaths per 100,000 people, ranking second among ASEAN countries, second only to the Philippines.

;

;As for gun control, Thailand’s relevant laws are not strict. "Thai citizens who are over 20 years old need to undergo strict background checks before they can legally hold guns. They are not allowed to hold guns in public and can only be used for specific purposes such as self-defense and hunting. At the same time, citizens must put gun shells, springs Store them separately from bullets and other accessories and cannot be placed in the same place." Vaxin pointed out.

;

;But in addition to legal gun ownership, there are still a large number of imported guns and imitation weapons that can be freely traded on the black market and the Internet. Wa Xin said that similar black guns are common in Thailand.

;

;Investigation data from the Thai Police General Administration in 2019 showed that there were more than 31,400 gun-related cases in Thailand that year, of which more than 24,300 cases involved unregistered illegal guns, accounting for 10% of the cases. 77.5% of the total.

;

;“Many illegal firearms are smuggled into Thailand, and Internet sales are exacerbating this trend.” Krisanaporn, a criminologist at Thailand’s Rangsit University, told AFP, “However, only a few police officers have the online Knowledge, ability and experience in tracking the gun market."

;

;After the shooting tragedy, the Thai police acted vigorously and arrested 6 suspects for selling guns and ammunition to the teenager who committed the crime. At the same time, Thai officials have made it clear that they will strengthen gun control measures and close legal loopholes in online gun sales.

;

;On October 5, Thailand’s Ministry of Interior held a meeting and approved 13 gun control measures, including strengthening the registration and management of firearms, stopping the issuance of firearms business licenses and carry-on firearms permits, and requiring gun owners to Short-term and long-term gun control measures include providing medical certification of mental health conditions, cracking down on illegal weapons trading websites, and redefining imitation guns.

;

;In fact, similar measures are just bringing up old matters again. After the tragedy of the nursery massacre in 2022, the lower house of the Thai Parliament stated that it would explore short-term and long-term measures for gun control and response to gun violence. However, until the general election in May 2023, the gun amnesty bill drafted by the previous government failed to pass parliamentary review.

;

;Some experts are not optimistic about how effective the new gun control measures will be. A commentary article published on the American Diplomat website stated that short-term policy adjustments cannot fundamentally solve the problem of black market gun trading, and the Thai government must give up its laissez-faire mentality of tolerating the illegal economy.

;

;(Li Qian and Huahua are pseudonyms in the article)

; Mon, 09 Oct 2023 16:25:03 +0800 掏大钱才得见“优质异性”：“相亲顾问”套路深http://www.infzm.com/contents/258208

;

;Because of hitting a wall in reality or the dating circle is too narrow and lacks "dating resources", go to the dating website to try your luck , it is indeed the choice of some people, but what is the outcome?

;

;A netizen’s complaint gives us a glimpse into the words and routines of “dating consultants”.

;

;He once received a call from a blind date website, asking him to talk about their blind date services. The dating consultant asked him to find out that he was a manager of a private enterprise, with an annual income of 400,000+, and that he had a house, a car and no loans, so he recommended a dating service with a price of 70,000, and even said to him: For a high-income person like you, 70,000 is not enough. It's not a high price, but we can provide emotional services. Then he pulled up two resumes with specific information concealed from his mobile phone. Both of them had a photo of a beautiful woman. He told him that both beauties had paid membership fees of N million, and their requirements were very suitable for his situation. As long as Once he joins the association, he can immediately arrange to meet and get to know each other.

;

;But his psychological price is less than 10,000. He said that 70,000 yuan was an unaffordable price for him. Seeing that he was about to get up and leave, the dating consultant said in a very disdainful tone, "What we are talking about now is your life-long event. If you yourself feel that you are not worth tens of thousands of dollars, then there is nothing we can do." The dating consultant also emphasized that , "Many of our members have paid membership fees of hundreds of thousands or hundreds of thousands a year, but I didn't mention it to you considering your income level." He replied, not thinking that his life event is not worth 70,000, but just I feel that this kind of service is not worth 70,000 yuan. As for hundreds of thousands or hundreds of thousands, only XX would spend such a big sum of money.

;

;Two days later, the dating consultant called him and said in a familiar and friendly manner that if paying 70,000 at once was too much, the website could provide installment payments and discounts. He also recommended other packages, but he hung up the phone directly.

;

;Similar scenes have been exposed by the media for a long time: the target is locked in a room for two to three hours for brainwashing, and is required to pay tens of thousands of yuan in membership fees; after registration, harassment calls are received from various numbers Phone call; after registering, you were invited to go to the offline store, but after paying the money, your attitude was perfunctory.

;

;This netizen said that in his opinion, spending tens of thousands of yuan to buy a blind date service is a bit ridiculous. It was not until he saw someone actually posting a blind date service bill of 32,000 yuan that he felt that he was short-sighted. .

;

;In fact, it is not that he is short-sighted, but that in the face of the powerful words and targeted bombing sales of some dating websites, some people will eventually be unable to defeat him. In March 2022, The Paper reported that through phone calls and WeChat, a marriage agency claiming to be from the "MarryU Club high-end membership club" continued to promote "high-end marriage consulting services" to Ms. Guo in Beijing, and promised to be able to provide services during the service period. Help her find the right match. Ms. Guo came to an offline physical franchise store on the platform and signed a 480-day membership service contract and supplementary agreement worth nearly 170,000 yuan. It was agreed that a company in Hangzhou would entrust a consulting and management company in Beijing to perform contract services and promised to provide Ms. Guo with a customized version of "marriage hunting services."

;

;News reports tell us that the lady’s 170,000 yuan was wasted. During the follow-up service process, Ms. Guo discovered that the identity of the men provided for appointments on the platform was questionable, and some had discrepancies in age and workplace information. Some did not even leave their WeChat or contact information after meeting. “Even if they were added, (the other party) would not No reaction." While the contract was in effect, Ms. Guo met her current husband in an accidental private social interaction, and the two received their marriage certificate in December 2021. After the marriage, Ms. Guo thought she could return a certain percentage of the service fee, but was rejected by the matchmaking agency on the grounds that she violated the contract by "marrying a candidate who was not recommended by the agency."

;

;If you think what happened to Ms. Guo is just an accident, you are totally wrong. Data show that in the first half of 2019, the Jucomplaint platform received a total of 1,686 valid complaints from consumers across the country regarding the dating and dating industry. In the current period, 993 complaints were confirmed to have been resolved, with a resolution rate of 58.9%. Judging from the types of complaints, they mainly include exaggerated service effects and difficulty in refunding. To put it bluntly, some dating platforms are playing tricks on you, and they don’t care about the wine but your wallet.

;

;In the folk, "matchmaker's words" have long been the driving force for young people to come together. Theoretically, a dating website is a "virtual matchmaker", but in reality, this "virtual matchmaker" often shows characteristics that are contrary to the function of a matchmaker. The most important characteristic of a matchmaker is to use his sharp tongue to facilitate the marriage between a man and a woman as quickly as possible. However, some dating websites are just the opposite. Their core appeal is to try their best to sign a long-term contract. To this end, they delay and consume all kinds of things until the contract is due. Period, make a lot of money.

;

;The purpose of paying a large membership fee is to find high-quality men and women, but a disturbing problem is that on some dating websites, there are really high-quality men and women waiting for you, and you only need to pay enough to find the right one. Object? In fact, you can know the answer just by looking at the logic lines.

;

;In reality, high-quality men and women have long been robbed of their heads. Do they still need to go to a blind date platform? It is said that some platforms have a large number of high-quality men and women, and after paying the money, it is yours. Is this a joke?

;

;When you pay a membership fee to a blind date website, you are essentially paying an agency fee. But many times, the agency fee is very strange.

;

;In the field of real estate, intermediaries still have "business rules". They can only charge fees after the house sale is completed, so real estate agents try their best to bring both parties together to reach a deal. However, some dating websites induce eager men and women to spend their money and are irresponsible for the results. They can actually continue to have a prosperous business and have no worries about customer sources. Do they really benefit from the "people are stupid and have more money"?

;

;Many members of the dating platform spend tens of thousands, hundreds of thousands or even hundreds of thousands, which is really no less than the agency fee for buying a house - the "bulk transactions" displayed in this kind of marriage and love market are full of of fantasy and absurdity.

;

;Some dating platforms engage in the practice of fabricating portraits, deceiving you, and cutting as many leeks as you can. They are despicable and shameless, but they always gain the upper hand with a series of misleading and risk-mitigating techniques. This makes many consumers miserable.

;

;Those who frequently talk to you about money are not just scammers, but also people who engage in "dating tricks". It is common sense to realize that it is unlikely that a dating website will have high-quality men and women, it is unlikely that you can get "more" by spending more money, and it is unlikely that you will be invincible with the "guidance" of a dating consultant.

;

;Finding a partner “online” certainly has a certain effect – in fact, I have friends who found true love online, but do I have to find some “professional platform” to find a partner? not necessarily. The aforementioned Ms. Guo signed a contract but found the right person outside the platform. This "accident" that slapped the platform in the face fully demonstrates that hot life scenes are the "incubation" base for relationships. Sometimes, when you can't find a partner, it's not because you haven't entered the "professional platform", but because your effective social circle is not large enough, or in other words, you are not deep enough in the ocean of life.

;

;If you really can't meet the right person on your own, then use your parents, relatives, friends, and colleagues to exert energy and accumulate opportunities, and at the same time try to expand your private social circle and personal media display circle to open up opportunities for yourself. The door to marriage and love is still a trustworthy path. At least, if you take this path, your wallet will not be hurt, your armor will be thrown away, and you will have nowhere to complain.

;

;The rise of e-commerce platforms has had a big impact on offline shopping. Coupled with the increase in consumption in recent years, After downgrading, many users, including me, have to shop around online before placing an order, and even start shopping on some platforms that are famous for their low prices, and they still find it really delicious. With such an unstoppable consumer trend, I thought that physical stores would definitely not be able to open. However, after observing my parents’ consumption behavior, I understood how physical stores can maintain a competitive advantage.

;

;My hometown has a newly built self-built house with many rooms and toilets, so there is no one-time renovation. I took advantage of the e-commerce shopping festival to buy a bathroom cabinet for the restroom. This is the product I ordered after reading countless posts on how to choose bathroom ware online. After it was delivered to my hometown, I made an appointment with the installer, and nothing went wrong in the process. The only question came from my dad. In addition to expressing his dissatisfaction with the price, he also asked me a soul-searching question: "Why don't you go to a store near home to buy it? I know you, it will be easier to repair in the future." I can't answer this question, because The reason for online shopping is to pursue cost-effectiveness, but my prices are uncompetitive in front of him.

;

;When I returned to my hometown, my dad couldn’t wait to take me to the bathroom they used and asked me to guess how much the bathroom cabinet in front of me cost. I said I couldn’t guess, “500 yuan!” With a proud look on his face, I could even see his inner monologue: "See if I'm very good. Online shopping is just a cloud!" He explained to me: "This is a sample from the boss's clearance, and I took it away. "Of course I know that there is a difference between three-no products with nothing and brand-name products. The most direct reflection is the price, but the low price really shocked me.

;

;Misfortune never comes singly. After I went home and used the newly installed bathroom cabinet several times, I found that the sink and water pipe connections were not tightened, causing water to seep and drip onto the floor. There was no hexagonal wrench at home, and my dad was sarcastic to me again. If there was something wrong with his bathroom cabinet or water heater, he could just walk a few hundred meters and call someone to repair it, but I could only figure out a solution on my own. So, that bathroom cabinet is still seeping water, and the sound of water dripping on the tiles is my dad’s accusation against me.

;

;Looking at it this way, it seems that physical stores rely on price wars to win online shopping. In fact, this is not the case. It’s just that my dad’s consumption concept makes him choose low-priced products. In essence, physical stores still rely on their touchability. The excellent after-sales service earns consumers' dependence and trust on it. What’s even more amazing is that it also allows users to pay by providing emotional value.

;

;One summer night, my parents went shopping to enjoy the cool air. When they came back, they brought a water purifier and a staff member. They also carried a complimentary air purifier and juicer upstairs. I was worried that the two elderly people had been deceived, so I quickly dragged my dad aside and asked him what was going on. The thing is that they were "bewitched" and immediately bought a water purifier. The price was less than 5,000 yuan, and it also came with two gifts. The brand is a regular brand, the store is a regular store, and the staff accompanying me also wear polo shirts with the brand logo printed on them. I subconsciously used my mobile phone to open the brand's online store and looked for the model my dad bought. After searching to no avail, I consulted online customer service. It turned out that the online and offline models were different. I didn’t buy fakes, but looking at the two gifts, I knew they must be expensive. I still don’t understand the reason why wool comes from sheep.

;

;My dad is a person who likes petty bargains, but buying a water purifier is not because it is cheap or because of the two gifts, but because the staff really win people's hearts. They are not robots in online shopping malls that use text to express intimacy. The guy who came to my house to install a water purifier, after being in contact with him for a while, I thought I might not be able to help but pay for him. During the installation process, he patiently explained the knowledge about use and maintenance to my parents. After completion, he was not in a hurry to leave, but opened the packaging of the juicer and demonstrated how to use it. I was standing aside at that time, knowing how to operate the juicer without reading the manual, so he could leave and get off work. But he asked my mother for bananas and milk, put them in the cup, pressed the button, and explained the operation at the same time. The juicer made a sound like an electric drill. My parents stood beside him quietly, watching with smiles. After the juice was finished, he poured two glasses and handed them to my parents. The three of them were talking and laughing. I was at the other end of the living room, watching this scene, and it felt like they were a family of three. Do you think it's worth the money?

;

;This is the emotional value that online shopping is difficult to provide. In addition to a large number of middle-aged and elderly people who cannot use smartphones and shop online, there is also a group of people who firmly believe in physical stores and that only tangible products in the store and face-to-face sales staff can bring a sense of security. The e-commerce economy is booming, but many physical stores are not only surviving, but doing well. I think this is also a little bit of the needs of contemporary people who are prone to emotional emptiness. They need companionship, comfort, real touch and face-to-face communication. Only such care can make cold materials have extra value, and can Be willing to pay for it.
